meanings.definition: A person or thing that suppresses or defeats completely.
meanings.sent1: The quasher of the rebellion was celebrated for restoring peace.
meanings.sent2: The superhero was known as the quasher of all evil in the city.
meanings.sent3: The little quasher toy soldier defeated all the other toys in the battle.
meanings.sent4: The quasher of dreams, reality always seemed to win in the end.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the quasher of nightmares was a brave knight.

meanings.definition: To put down or suppress completely.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to quasher the rumors spreading in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The police were able to quasher the riot before it escalated.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to quasher the flames quickly to prevent a kitchen fire.
meanings.sent4: She tried to quasher her fears, but they kept creeping back in.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to quasher any doubts about their abilities.

meanings.sent1: The champion boxer quasher his opponent in the final round.
meanings.sent2: The army was able to quasher the enemy forces with strategic planning.
meanings.sent3: The student managed to quasher all doubts about his intelligence with his excellent grades.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed helped her quasher all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The hero's bravery allowed him to quasher the villain's evil plans.
